rev.comment: Stating "Google's mission" like it is a fact is a possible NPOV issue, perhaps?

'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}} and {{lse|GGEA}}) is an [[United States|American]] [[public company|public corporation]], specializing in [[Internet search]] and [[online advertising]]. The company had 9,378 full-time employees as of [[September 30]], 2006, and is based in [[Mountain View, California]]. Google's mission statement is "to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful."<ref>http://www.google.com/corporate/</ref>
Google was co-founded by [[Lawrence E. Page|Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]], and was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on [[September 7]] [[1998]]. [[Eric E. Schmidt|Eric Schmidt]] has been Google's [[chief executive officer]] since Larry Page stepped down.
Google was co-founded by [[Lawrence E. Page|Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]], and was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on [[September 7]] [[1998]]. [[Eric E. Schmidt|Eric Schmidt]] has been Google's [[chief executive officer]] since Larry Page stepped down.
